Is there anyway to make the image alt text required in module fields?
Is there ever a time that the image would be presentational and not critical content? If so, it’s actually fine to allow empty alt

First and foremost. Alt text’s primary purpose is for accessibility. It exists so that screen readers can relay to users using assistive tech what the image conveys. There are times such as presentational images, where it doesn’t make sense to convey to the user anything about the image. Example: an image that shows a visual lens flare. It has no relevance to the content, it is just there to make it visually look nice. Having alt text would result in the screen reader going “Hey there’s an image here, it says it’s a camera like lens flare, with glowing rays radiating from it”

Especially to a blind person that alt text would make them go “Great, I have no idea what a lens flare is, glowing isn’t a concept that means a lot to me and I have no idea why that relates to this article about the product I’m learning about”.

Secondly from the SEO perspective, take that same example: What does that presentational image have to do with your product/service? It likely would bring no value SEO wise to you as no one looking for your product/service is searching for “Cool lens flare”.

Because of this, providing an empty alt text saves both the a11y side, and the confusion that it might cause a search engine.
hopefully that made you laugh a bit but it’s the truth. To learn more about alt text this is a great article <https://www.a11yproject.com/posts/2013-01-14-alt-text/>
